events.message: The customer reported an auto accident that occurred on April 30th involving their vehicle rear-ending another car at a traffic light.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and determining the involvement of the policyholder's vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle communication, investigation, and follow-up with the claimant.
The claimant received an official acknowledgment of their auto accident claim along with an outline of the next steps for processing.
The customer was requested to submit a police report, photos of vehicle damage, and a repair estimate to support their claim.
The claimant provided all requested documentation including the official police report and repair shop estimates within the deadline.
Investigation into the details of the collision commenced, including assessment of fault and review of submitted evidence.
The investigation was completed confirming that the claimant was not at fault and damage estimates were consistent with the accident.
A settlement amount covering vehicle repair costs and towing fees was proposed to the claimant for approval.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt response and clarity of the settlement offer presented by our agent.
The insurance claim was approved after acceptance of the proposed settlement by the claimant without any disputes.
Payment covering the agreed settlement amount was issued to the claimantâ€™s preferred bank account.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation from the claimant that repairs were underway.
The completed claim file was archived in the system for future reference and compliance with regulatory record-keeping policies.
